description: Nikola Petrak advises the citywide committee to reject Halden's spiral override and urges establishment of a unified, citywide BCI framework to avoid chaos and abuse.
Committee inspection reveals BCI fragments enforcing conflicting rules in different zones, leading to public confusion and fear as daily life is affected inconsistently.
Committee, following Nikola’s recommendation, officially cancels technical support for local spiral overrides and begins drafting a new protocol to re-unify BCI standards citywide.
Negotiations stall as rival zones, each controlled by inherited Council faction rules, refuse compromise. Residents face growing frustration and isolation as sector experiences diverge.
Leaked documents confirm each BCI subsystem is run by legacy Council codes, fueling distrust and spurring zone leaders to draft proposals to formally partition Stenograd's management.
